info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EFFINGHAM, HAMPTON AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 559 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Garnett, or 15 miles north of Springfield, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Estill, Furman, Scotia, Garnett, Pineland, Shirley, Robertville and Clyo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
